Brief Rationale: Antibiotic producers avoid esculin degradation, preserving energy for secondary metabolism rather than competing for β-glucosidase substrates
Citation: Niu, G., Chater, K. F., Tian, Y., Zhang, J., & Tan, H. (2016). Specialised metabolites regulating antibiotic biosynthesis in Streptomyces spp. FEMS Microbiology Reviews, 40(4), 554-573.

Brief Rationale: Complex peptides/amino acids from yeast extract support antibiotic biosynthesis better than inorganic nitrate reduction
Citation: Czajgucka, Z. et al. (2021). Influence of the Medium Composition and the Culture Conditions on Surfactin Biosynthesis by a Native Bacillus subtilis natto BS19 Strain. Molecules 26(10):2985

Brief Rationale: Avoids ammonia toxicity that interferes with antibiotic synthesis; pH buffered by CaCO₃ instead
Citation: Braña, A. F., Wolfe, S., & Demain, A. L. (1985). Ammonium repression of cephalosporin production by Streptomyces clavuligerus. Canadian Journal of Microbiology, 31(8), 736–743.

Brief Rationale: Alternative energy pathways using malt-derived mannans/oligosaccharides rather than conventional redox reactions
Citation: Shi, P., et al. (2011). Cloning and characterization of a new β-mannosidase from Streptomyces sp. S27. Enzyme and Microbial Technology, 49(3), 277-283.

Brief Rationale: Mannosidase/urease producers utilize complex malt oligosaccharides (maltotriose, dextrins) over simple glucose
Citation: Van Wezel, G.P., et al. (1997). Substrate induction and glucose repression of maltose utilization by Streptomyces coelicolor A3(2) is controlled by malR. Molecular Microbiology, 23(3), 537-549.

Brief Rationale: Organisms suited to complex media with 50+ compounds from yeast/malt extracts, avoiding simple substrate competition
Citation: Aluotto, S., et al. (2013). Development of a semi-defined medium supporting production of platensimycin and platencin by Streptomyces platensis. Journal of Antibiotics, 66(2), 51-54.

Brief Rationale: Emphasis on glycosidase activities utilizing malt β-glucans and mannans over glucose oxidation
Citation: Malgas, S., et al. (2015). A review of the enzymatic hydrolysis of mannans and synergistic interactions between β-mannanase, β-mannosidase and α-galactosidase. World Journal of Microbiology and Biotechnology, 31(8), 1167-1175.

Brief Rationale: Absence of esculin, nitrate, glucose utilization indicates reliance on diverse amino acids, nucleotides, vitamins from extracts
Citation: Hopwood, D. A. (2019). Highlights of Streptomyces genetics. Heredity, 123(1), 23-32.

Brief Rationale: Alpha-mannosidase and urease activities support Streptomyces-like traits on pH-buffered (CaCO₃) rich medium
Citation: Demain, A. L., & Inamine, E. (1970). Biochemistry and regulation of streptomycin and mannosidostreptomycinase (α-D-mannosidase) formation. Bacteriological Reviews, 34(1), 1–19.

Brief Rationale: GYM medium’s B-vitamins (especially B₃, B₅, B₆) and trace metals (Fe, Zn, Mn) support polyketide/peptide antibiotic pathways
Citation: Van der Heul, H.U., et al. (2018). Regulation of antibiotic production in Actinobacteria: new perspectives from the post-genomic era. Nature Product Reports, 35, 575-604.
